document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Ophrynopus Konow, 1897 (Hymenoptera: Orussidae), with a new definition of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Ophrynopus Konow, 1897 (Hymenoptera: Orussidae), with a new definition of the genus

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Natural History Museum of Denmark, SCIENCE, University of Copenhagen, Zoological Museum, Universitetsparken 15, DK- 2100, Denmark.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ophrynopus rupestris
Vilhelmsen, Costa & Alvarenga, 2013
in
Vilhelmsen et al. 2013

Ophrynopus andrei Konow, 1897a
is considered to be a junior subjective synonym of
Ophrynopus fulvostigma ( Westwood, 1874 )
. Vilhelmsen & Smith (2002) and
Vilhelmsen et al. (2013)
used the coloration of the fore and mid tibiae to separate the two species (reddish brown in
O. andrei
, dark brown to black in
O. fulvostigma
; both species have the hind femur reddish brown, contrary to what is stated in Vilhelmsen & Smith [2002] ). Indeed, this seems to be the only significant difference.
Vilhelmsen et al. (2017)
likewise recently synonymized several Afrotropical species of Orussidae in
Chalinus Konow, 1897a
, which were also only distinguishable by differences in leg coloration. Furthermore, of three males of
O. fulvostigma
collected on consecutive days at Panacocha at the Napo River in Ecuador (see Appendix), the two collected on February 28 th had reddish brown femora throughout, whereas the one collected on
March 1 st 1993
had dark brown fore and mid femora, indicating that the color differences represents intraspecific variation rather than a diagnostic character at the species level. The dark legged variant seems to be the most common and widespread, e.g., all the
O. fulvostigma
specimens from French Guiana listed in Appendix 1 and in
Vilhelmsen et al. (2013
; appendix 1);

A revised key to
Ophrynopus
species (including couplets to separate the other genera in the ophrynopine clade from
Ophrynopus
) is presented further below.
